item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, February 2, 2025 at 9:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Everyone knows your location: tracking myself down through in-app ads (535 points | 179 comments)
2. Waydroid – Android in a Linux container (34 points | 4 comments)
3. ScatterBrain: Unmasking the shadow of PoisonPlug's obfuscator (33 points | 1 comment)
4. Why do War Thunder players leak classified information? [video] (37 points | 21 comments)
5. The dumb reason why flag emojis aren't working on your site in Chrome on Windows (20 points | 1 comment)
6. Reverse-engineering and analysis of SanDisk High Endurance microSDXC card (2020) (203 points | 77 comments)
7. Show HN: Lume – OS lightweight CLI for MacOS and Linux VMs on Apple Silicon (200 points | 58 comments)
8. Repeat offenders may be responsible for many shark attacks (25 points | 11 comments)
9. Show HN: Groundhog AI Spring API (39 points | 14 comments)
10. Analyzing the codebase of Caffeine, a high performance caching library (174 points | 30 comments)
11. Life is more than an engineering problem (274 points | 156 comments)
12. Spaced repetition can allow for infinite recall (2022) (108 points | 125 comments)
13. Ask HN: What is interviewing like now with everyone using AI? (54 points | 54 comments)
14. Show HN: ESP32 RC Cars (237 points | 41 comments)
15. Sniffnet – monitor your Internet traffic (148 points | 56 comments)
16. Macrodata Refinement (551 points | 292 comments)
17. Inheritance and Subtyping (34 points | 26 comments)
18. The PETG adhesive test [video] (37 points | 15 comments)
19. RLHF Book (377 points | 30 comments)
20. The Legacy of Lies in Alzheimer's Science (3 points | discuss)
21. UK betting giant's unlawful marketing kept suicidal gambler hooked (15 points | 2 comments)
22. AstroForge selects target for "high risk, seat of the pants" asteroid mission (85 points | 57 comments)
23. Show HN: Modest – musical harmony library for Lua (53 points | 6 comments)
24. Fixing left and mutual recursions in grammars (87 points | 21 comments)
25. The Door Problem (2014) (16 points | 4 comments)
26. Recent results show that LLMs struggle with compositional tasks (298 points | 238 comments)
27. A Rust procedural language handler for PostgreSQL (100 points | 19 comments)
28. Bzip3: A spiritual successor to BZip2 (316 points | 167 comments)
29. Visualizing all books of the world in ISBN-Space (456 points | 85 comments)
30. A loophole used by Shein/Temu to ship packages to US tax-free (4 points | 1 comment)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, February 2, 2025 at 9:10 PM UTC
